uw_elevation.content:
* On Mar. 19, the UW light rail station opens next to Husky Stadium, where crosswalks and a new bridge offer easy access to bicycles and pedestrians.
* The station will provide 130 rain-shielded rack spaces for locking bikes.
* Trains will run every six minutes during peak hours, every ten minutes during midday, and every 15 minutes after 10pm.
* The first train will leave the station at 4:45 a.m., and the final train returns at 12:50 a.m.

uw_buses.content:
* The impact of UW Station will be widened, by connecting bus routes that carry rail users an extra mile or farther.
* Here are the local buses within walking distance, as well as connections to Snohomish County or the Eastside, starting from Mar. 26.
* Some passengers may arrive on Lake City or Highway 520 by bus, then hop a train to Sodo stadiums or the airport. There is no park-and-ride near the station.

uw_employers.content:
* The new station will serve many of the 5,000 workers at UW Medical Center.
* The shaded circle on the map marks a half-mile radius, but private shuttle buses and the Burke-Gilman Trail lead to Seattle Childrens Hospital, which employs 6,340 people.
* Of course, there's also the 40,000 students at the UW itself, plus faculty and nearby businesses.

full_line.content:
* The UW and Capitol Hill stations, shown in red, are expected to add 45,000 weekday passengers to the system by 2021, for a total of 80,000.
* Angle Lake Station will be added south of the airport in Fall 2016, and a station in Northgate is planned for Fall 2021
